I'll start by exploring the repository structure to understand what kind of project this is and get familiar with the codebase. find "c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master" -maxdepth 2 -type f -name "*.md" | head -20 c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/AGENTS.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/CONTRIBUTING.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/README.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/SECURITY.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/README.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/CLAUDE.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/classic/README.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/docs/README.md c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/README.md

AutoGPT

AutoGPT Platform: Build, deploy, and run custom AI agents with a visual workflow builder.

AutoGPT Classic: The original AI agent (a.k.a. Forge + AutoGPT).

üåü Star the repo   Star the repo to stay informed about new releases and updates

--- ## üìñ Table of Contents 1. [About AutoGPT](#about-autogpt) - [AutoGPT Platform](#autogpt-platform) - [AutoGPT Classic](#autogpt-classic) 2. [Getting Started](#getting-started) - [Requirements](#requirements) - [Quickstart](#quickstart) 3. [Documentation](#documentation) 4. [Roadmap](#roadmap) 5. [Acknowledgements](#acknowledgements) --- ## About AutoGPT ### AutoGPT Platform > **Build powerful AI agents without code** AutoGPT Platform lets you build, test, and deploy AI agents with a drag-and-drop interface. Features include: - **Visual builder**: Create complex AI workflows without writing code. - **Blocks**: Use pre-built integrations with popular tools and services. - **Store**: Share or sell your agents in a growing marketplace. - **Cloud-hosted**: Run your agents 24/7 without managing infrastructure. - **Self-hosting**: Deploy on your own infrastructure if you prefer. [Try AutoGPT Platform for free ‚Üí](https://platform.agpt.co/) ### AutoGPT Classic > **The original autonomous AI agent** AutoGPT Classic pioneered the concept of LLM agents autonomously "thinking" to accomplish a goal. Capabilities include: - **Web browsing and search**: Finds information online. - **File management**: Reads, writes, and organizes files. - **Code execution**: Runs Python and shell scripts. - **Plugin system**: Extend functionality with community plugins. Classic is now in **maintenance mode**. We recommend using the AutoGPT Platform for new projects. --- ## Getting Started ### Requirements - **Docker** (recommended) ‚Äì If you want a containerized environment. - **Git** ‚Äì To clone the repository. - **API Keys** ‚Äì You'll need an API key for at least one LLM provider (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic). ### Quickstart #### AutoGPT Platform The easiest way to get started is to use the hosted version at [platform.agpt.co](https://platform.agpt.co/). For self-hosting: ```bash git clone https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas/AutoGPT.git cd AutoGPT/autogpt_platform cp .env.default .env # Edit .env with your settings docker compose up -d ``` See [Platform Setup](./autogpt_platform/README.md) for detailed instructions. #### AutoGPT Classic ```bash git clone https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas/AutoGPT.git cd AutoGPT/classic/original_autogpt cp .env.template .env # Edit .env with your API keys docker compose up -d ``` See [Classic Setup](./classic/README.md) for detailed instructions. --- ## Documentation | Resource | URL | |----------|-----| | üìö Platform Docs | [docs.agpt.co](https://docs.agpt.co/) | | üìö Classic Docs | [docs.agpt.co/classic](https://docs.agpt.co/classic) | | üí¨ Discord Community | [discord.gg/autogpt](https://discord.gg/autogpt) | | üê¶ Twitter Updates | [@Auto_GPT](https://twitter.com/Auto_GPT) | --- ## Roadmap ### AutoGPT Platform - [ ] Advanced scheduling and triggers - [ ] Multi-agent collaboration features - [ ] Enhanced store with agent analytics - [ ] Mobile app for monitoring agents - [ ] Enterprise features (SSO, audit logs, etc.) ### AutoGPT Classic - [x] Maintenance mode (no major new features planned) - [x] Security patches and critical bug fixes --- ## Acknowledgements AutoGPT is built by [Significant Gravitas](https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas) and our amazing community. Special thanks to: - All our [contributors](https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas/AutoGPT/graphs/contributors) - The open-source AI community ---

---

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Significant Gravitas

Build/Run/Test Commands ### Backend (Python/FastAPI) ```bash cd autogpt_platform/backend # Install dependencies poetry install # Run the backend server poetry run app # Run tests poetry run pytest # All tests poetry run pytest backend/blocks/ # Block tests only poetry run pytest -k "test_name" # Specific test # Type checking poetry run pyright # Linting/formatting poetry run ruff check --fix # Lint and auto-fix poetry run ruff format # Format code ``` ### Frontend (Next.js/TypeScript) ```bash cd autogpt_platform/frontend # Install dependencies npm install # Run development server npm run dev # Build for production npm run build # Run tests npm test # Linting npm run lint ``` ### Full Platform (Docker) ```bash cd autogpt_platform # Start all services docker compose up -d # View logs docker compose logs -f # Stop services docker compose down ``` ## Architecture Overview The AutoGPT Platform follows a modular architecture: ``` autogpt_platform/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ backend/ # Python FastAPI backend ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ backend/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ blocks/ # Individual automation blocks (each file = one block type) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/ # Database models and queries (Prisma) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ executor/ # Graph execution engine ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server/ # API routes and handlers ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ integrations/ # OAuth and external service integrations ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.prisma # Database schema ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ frontend/ # Next.js React frontend ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app/ # Next.js app router pages ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/# React components ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ lib/ # Utility libraries ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ public/ # Static assets ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ autogpt_libs/ # Shared Python libraries ``` ## Key Concepts ### Blocks Blocks are the fundamental building units. Each block: - Lives in `backend/backend/blocks/` - Inherits from `Block` base class - Defines `Input` and `Output` schemas using Pydantic - Implements a `run()` method that processes inputs and yields outputs Example block structure: ```python class MyBlock(Block): class Input(BlockSchema): field: str = SchemaField(description="...") class Output(BlockSchema): result: str = SchemaField(description="...") def run(self, input_data: Input, **kwargs) -> BlockOutput: yield "result", processed_value ``` ### Graphs Graphs connect blocks together: - Defined in `backend/data/graph.py` - Nodes reference block types and contain configuration - Links connect output pins of one node to input pins of another ### Execution The executor (`backend/executor/`) handles: - Scheduling graph runs - Managing execution state - Processing blocks in dependency order - Handling async operations and webhooks ## Database - Uses PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM - Schema defined in `backend/schema.prisma` - Migrations in `backend/migrations/` To apply migrations: ```bash cd autogpt_platform/backend poetry run prisma migrate dev ``` ## Common Patterns ### Adding a New Block 1. Create file in `backend/backend/blocks/` 2. Define Input/Output schemas 3. Implement the `run()` method 4. Block auto-registers via `__init__.py` imports ### API Routes - REST routes in `backend/server/routers/` - WebSocket handling in `backend/server/ws_api.py` - Authentication via Supabase JWT ### Testing - Use pytest fixtures from `conftest.py` - Mock external services in tests - Integration tests may require database setup ls -la "c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/" total 31 drwxr-xr-x 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 . drwxr-xr-x 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 .. -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 2073 Jun 9 18:08 .env.default -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 179 Jun 9 18:08 .gitignore -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 3125 Jun 9 18:08 CLAUDE.md -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 3217 Jun 9 18:08 Contributor License Agreement (CLA).md -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 604 Jun 9 18:08 LICENSE.md -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 1265 Jun 9 18:08 Makefile -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 3749 Jun 9 18:08 README.md -rw-r--r-- 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 __init__.py drwxr-xr-x 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 autogpt_libs drwxr-xr-x 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 backend drwxr-xr-x 1 1 197609 0 Jun 9 18:08 frontend Now I have a good understanding of this repository. This is the **AutoGPT Platform** - a system for building, deploying, and running custom AI agents with a visual workflow builder. ## Repository Summary **Project**: AutoGPT Platform - an AI agent automation platform with: 1. **Backend** (`autogpt_platform/backend/`) - Python FastAPI backend - **Blocks** (`backend/blocks/`) - Modular automation units (LLM, HTTP, integrations with GitHub, Google, Twitter, Discord, etc.) - **Executor** (`backend/executor/`) - Graph execution engine for running workflows - **Server** (`backend/server/`) - REST API routes, WebSocket handling - **Data** (`backend/data/`) - Database models using Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL 2. **Frontend** (`autogpt_platform/frontend/`) - Next.js React application - Visual drag-and-drop workflow builder - Agent store/marketplace 3. **Shared Libraries** (`autogpt_platform/autogpt_libs/`) - Common Python utilities for auth, logging, rate limiting 4. **Classic AutoGPT** (`classic/`) - The original autonomous AI agent (in maintenance mode) ### Key Architecture Patterns: - **Blocks**: Self-contained units with Pydantic Input/Output schemas and a `run()` method - **Graphs**: Connect blocks via nodes and links to create workflows - **Execution**: Scheduler processes graphs in dependency order - **Auth**: Supabase JWT-based authentication - **Database**: PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM ### Critical Files for Implementation: - `c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/backend/backend/blocks/block.py` - Base Block class definition - `c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/backend/backend/data/graph.py` - Graph model and operations - `c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/backend/backend/executor/manager.py` - Execution engine - `c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/backend/backend/server/rest_api.py` - Main API setup - `c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/backend/schema.prisma` - Database schema
